subject: Education
title: The Factory Model: Bells, Rows, and Age Groups
description: A 60-second lesson on The Factory Model: Bells, Rows, and Age Groups.

hook.text: School bells ring every 45 minutes. Ever wonder why?

buildup.text: Industrial-age schools were modeled on factories: standardized, efficient, scalable.

discovery.text: Age-graded classes, fixed schedules, and uniform curricula made mass education possible.

twist.text: The model optimized for compliance and throughput, not for individual learning.

climax.text: Most schools still run on this 150-year-old operating system.

punchline.text: The classroom was designed for an economy that no longer exists.

quiz.question: Why were industrial-age schools structured like factories?
options: To create standardized, scalable mass education efficiently
Because factory owners ran all the schools
